name: Benin
description: Benin, officially the Republic of Benin, is a country located along the Gulf of Guinea in West Africa. It shares borders with Togo to the west, Nigeria to the east, Burkina Faso and Niger to the north, and Ghana to the south. Known for its rich history, vibrant culture, and stunning natural landscapes, Benin offers a unique blend of tradition and modernity.

quickFacts.label: Capital
quickFacts.detail: Porto-Novo is a bustling city located on the southern bank of the Ouémé River, offering a glimpse into the nation's administrative heart.

quickFacts.label: Population
quickFacts.description: Benin's population is diverse and growing.
quickFacts.detail: The majority of the population is of ethnic Yoruba origin, with significant populations of Fon, Bariba, and Kabye.

quickFacts.label: Official Language
quickFacts.description: French is the official language of Benin.
quickFacts.detail: However, several indigenous languages are also widely spoken throughout the country.

quickFacts.label: Currency
quickFacts.detail: The CFA franc is pegged to the Euro.

quickFacts.label: Area
quickFacts.detail: It is slightly smaller than the state of Maryland in the United States.

quickFacts.label: GDP (2023)
quickFacts.detail: The economy is largely based on agriculture and oil production.

climateData.title: Climate of Benin
climateData.description: Benin experiences a tropical climate with two distinct seasons: a hot, rainy season and a cooler, drier season. The coastal areas are generally humid year-round.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Harmattan
seasonalCharacteristics.description: The Harmattan is a dry and dusty trade wind that blows from the Sahara Desert, bringing cooler temperatures and reduced rainfall.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Rainy Season
seasonalCharacteristics.description: This season is characterized by high humidity, frequent rainfall, and warm temperatures. It's the agricultural peak.

naturalWonders.name: Lake Ganvie
naturalWonders.description: Lake Ganvie is a remarkable feat of engineering and a testament to the ingenuity of the Ganvie people. This entire village is built on stilts in the lake, creating a unique and vibrant community.
naturalWonders.detailedDescription: The lake is a vital source of fish and water for the villagers, and the stilt houses are constructed from wood and palm leaves. It's a truly unforgettable sight.
viewingTips: Respect the local culture and traditions.
Hire a local guide for a deeper understanding.

naturalWonders.name: Parc National de PAFW
naturalWonders.description: The Parc National de PAFW (Parc National de Faune et Flore d'Atakora) is a protected area in the Atakora Mountains, home to a diverse range of wildlife and plant species.
naturalWonders.detailedDescription: The park is a crucial habitat for endangered species like the chimpanzee and various bird species. It's a vital area for biodiversity conservation.
viewingTips: Hire a local guide for optimal wildlife spotting.

ecosystemData.title: Ecosystems of Benin
ecosystemData.overview: Benin’s ecosystems are incredibly diverse, ranging from coastal mangroves to dense rainforests and savanna grasslands. These ecosystems support a rich array of flora and fauna.

conservationStatus.protectedAreas: Approximately 15% of Benin’s land area is protected in national parks and reserves.

biodiversityCategories.name: Forest Ecosystems
biodiversityCategories.description: Benin is largely covered by tropical rainforests, playing a vital role in carbon sequestration and biodiversity.

statistics.details: A significant number of endemic tree species.
Supports a wide range of animal and plant life.

notableSpecies.name: African Grey Parrot
notableSpecies.significance: An iconic species known for its intelligence and vocalizations.

notableSpecies.name: Indri
notableSpecies.significance: A large lemur found in the higher elevations of the Atakora Mountains.

biodiversityCategories.name: Coastal Ecosystems
biodiversityCategories.description: Benin’s coastline is characterized by mangrove forests, sandy beaches, and coral reefs.

statistics.details: Provides crucial habitat for marine life.
Facing threats from pollution and climate change.

notableSpecies.name: Green Turtle
notableSpecies.significance: A threatened marine reptile that nests on Benin’s beaches.

notableSpecies.name: Dugong
notableSpecies.significance: A marine mammal found in the coastal waters.

activities.title: Activities in Benin
activities.description: Benin offers a diverse range of activities for travelers, from exploring historical sites to experiencing the natural beauty of the country.

activityCategories.name: Hiking
activityCategories.description: Explore the mountainous regions of Benin on foot.

activities.name: Atakora Mountains Trek
activities.description: Hike through the lush forests of the Atakora Mountains, discovering waterfalls and diverse wildlife.
activities.requirements: Sturdy hiking boots, water bottle, insect repellent.

activities.name: Lake Ganvie Exploration
activities.description: Explore the unique stilt village of Lake Ganvie and learn about the local culture.

activityCategories.name: Water Sports
activityCategories.description: Enjoy the coastal waters of Benin with various water sports activities.

activities.name: Fishing
activities.description: Experience traditional fishing techniques and catch your own fish.

activities.name: Kayaking
activities.description: Paddle through the mangroves and explore the coastline.

clothing.winter: Layers of clothing, a light jacket, and a hat.
clothing.yearRound: Comfortable walking shoes, a rain jacket.

equipment.hiking: Sturdy hiking boots, backpack, water bottle.
